title.narrative: INSTITUTIONAL FRAMEWORK-CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: In 2017, Chile has an institutional framework for the protection of children based on a legal framework, protocols, and regulations aligned with those of the CRC and it implements mechanisms and procedures that ensure comprehensive protection for the rights of children and adolescents., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children and adolescents have a comprehensive institutional framework for the protection of their rights, in accordance with the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC).

sector.narrative: Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse

Protective services for children on the move
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: In 2017, Chile has an institutional framework for the protection of children based on a legal framework, protocols, andregulations aligned with those of the CRC; and it implements mechanisms and procedures that ensure comprehensive protection for therights of children and adolescents.

description.narrative: Through evidence-based advocacy, UNICEF Chile helped strengthen the legal and institutional framework, and protocols and processes aimed at protecting child rights in the country, in view to create a Comprehensive Child Rights Protection System in Chile. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2018

title.narrative: Chile has a service providing special protection for children and adolescents and a service targeting children and adolescents who violate the law, promulgated with a rights approach in accordance with the CRC.

baseline.value: Chile has a public service providing special protection to children and adolescents who violate the law (2011).

actual.value: 2017:In 2017, draft legislation was introduced to create the National Service for Youth Social Reintegration and the National Service for Special Protection. Both draft Acts are currently in parliamentary discussions, within which UNICEF participated actively.

title.narrative: Law for the Protection of the Rights of the Child with a rights and gender approach.

baseline.value: Lack of a government-sponsored draft law on the protection of the rights of the child (2011).

actual.value: 2017:The Draft Child Rights Protection Act is currently in its second constitutional process in the Senate's Special Commission on childhood.

title.narrative: Chile has specific laws strengthening child protection, aligned with the CRC.

baseline.value: Lack of laws that prohibit corporal punishment in all forms (Corporal punishment only in the family environment has been banned since 2010) and protection of migrant children and adolescents (2011).

actual.value: 2016:All drafts law about violence were submitted by Deputies and Senators, but not by the Executive Power (Government). Concerning Migration Law, the Government (MInistry of Interior) announced its presentation for the period 2017 - 2018.
